de.gnwi.spicesviewer

Class ImageExportFileSinkImagesWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.SwingWorker
      • de.gnwi.spicesviewer.ImageExportFileSinkImagesWorker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture

    public class ImageExportFileSinkImagesWorker
extends javax.swing.SwingWorker
    A SwingWorker extending class to export the graph by GraphStream's FileSinkImages as an image file.
    Author:
    Jonas Schaub

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javax.swing.SwingWorker

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageExportFileSinkImagesWorker

        public ImageExportFileSinkImagesWorker(java.io.File anImageFile,
                                       org.graphstream.graph.implementations.SingleGraph aSingleGraph,
                                       MainFrame aMainFrame,
                                       UserPreferences aUserPreferences,
                                       Controller aController)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor: Tests the parameters and assigns them to the object's fields.
        Parameters:
        anImageFile - to which the image should be saved; It must not exist on the hard drive already and must be of type .png or .jpeg
        aSingleGraph - the GraphStream SingleGraph to be exported. Its node count determines the resolution of the written image file.
        aMainFrame - the MainFrame where to write a message when succeeded or failed
        aUserPreferences - to draw the color of the message in the MainFrame from
        aController - the instantiating Controller instance for showing a message in the MainFrame's status bar when the image export is successful
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one parameter is 'null', the image file already exists on the hard drive, the image file is not of type .png or .jpeg, the graph has no nodes or no stylesheet, or the UserPreferences' 'valid' color is 'null'

    • Method Detail

      • doInBackground

        protected java.lang.Object doInBackground()
        Exports the given graph by using GraphStream's FileSinkImages as an image file.

        Settings of FileSinkImages: FileSinkImages.LayoutPolicy.COMPUTED_FULLY_AT_NEW_IMAGE; FileSinkImages.OutputPolicy.BY_STEP; FileSinkImages.Quality.HIGH; FileSinkImages.RendererType.SCALA;

        The stylesheet from the graph is used for the image export so that it gives an exact representation of the graph. The resolution of the image file is dependent on the node count of the graph (node count times Constants.NODE_COUNT_TO_RESOLUTION_FACTOR) but has a minimum as set in Constants.IMAGE_FILE_MIN_WIDTH_AND_HIGHT. At higher node counts (margins are set in the different constants in the Constants class) the existing 'UHD_XK' resolutions from FileSinkImages.Resolutions are taken for the resolution. At high node counts and depending on the operating system this method can take very long to compute! At the beginning a dummy file is created on the hard drive to reserve the filename for this operation. If an exception occurs in the writing process a JOptionPane message dialog is opened. If no error occurs and the image file is written successfully the MainFrame displays a message in its status bar.

        Specified by:
        doInBackground in class javax.swing.SwingWorker
        Returns:
        null
